data.title: Amazing local food and people
data.text: My husband and I discovered this little gem last year and have become big fans.  Dave and Sarah, the owners, are great and really care about providing people with healthly, local and delicious food.  Their paninis are amazing and lots of great side dishes including fresh soups, salads, etc.  And good craft beer.  It also is a store that sells organic foods, bulk items and locals meats, cheeses and produce.  We encourage everyone to support this great local place.  We always meet interesting people here.

data.title: Not for the traditional taste
data.text: This place is definitely not for those who prefer traditional fare. It's great that the food is not processed and is mostly sourced locally but there aren't a lot of choices and except for soup there were no side items. My husband and I both liked the wheat bread. The flavor was not overwhelming but were less satisfied with the rest. I had a kale panini and he had Ham and cheese. We both thought they were just average. The service was ok. Not outright rude but not friendly either.

owner_response.author: Dave R, Owner at The Downtown Farm Stand, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Lisa,
Thanks for the review.  We are definitely of the belief that all restaurants should not be the same or traditional, we love variety. I saw on your reviews that you like a lot of chain restaurants and we simply are not like a chain.   I wanted to correct a couple of errors in your post, this is common in the review world.  We do not use wheat in our bread, it's whole grain organic spelt flour.  Also it states clearly on our menu that we offer two different salads, and three sides: roasted potatoes with garlic aioli, a seasonal fruit plate, and hummus with grilled bread.  We offer two soups everyday, one meat based and one vegetarian, and you can also get a side of seasoned grilled bread.  We also offer seasonal sides, like right now we have a delicious sweet and sour cucumber, onion, and tomato salad with produce from our farm.  Most of our customers are amazed at the variety we offer for a small restaurant where everything is made from scratch.  There's no excuse for non-friendly service or food that was just o.k. and I find that very surprising as our other reviews say differently.  It sounds like you were in the mood for plain, traditional mid-western food, and that just simply is not what we offer.   Thanks
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Lunch Time
data.text: We went for lunch.  The service was great!  I had a panini with chicken and a creamy garlic sauce which was really good.  It is a cool little organic type store with a deli.  The store itself could use a little updating.  But, other than that.  Not bad, not bad at all.

data.title: Whole food, whole people!
data.text:
I came to Muncie to participate in the 70.3 Ironman and stumbled upon this gem of a local farm to table store and deli.  You can feel the heart of the owners, Sarah and Dave, and -their dedication to support their local farming community, and to quality food.  I had a lovely salad, roast potatoes and a craft beer (tap) which was perfect as a pre-race dinner.  The friendly, community supportive, and welcoming atmosphere combined with the high quality food makes this an excellent stop for anyone who is a foodie!  Definitely recommend it to racers, guests and local folks alike.
However, don't go there if you are in a hurry.  Good food takes time. :)

data.title: Interesting concept excellent cuisine
data.text: Downtown inside a market but the food is unbelievably delicious. Have enjoyed every menu item we have tried and will continue to frequent this joint.

data.title: Great Breakfast Panini
data.text: I wanted to try someplace local while visiting BSU.  This sounded interesting and different and it was. The atmosphere is earthy and charming. My breakfast panini was excellent.  It is a store/deli.   I will return with my husband next time.

data.title: A Different Experience
data.text: Went with the wife for lunch.  Our goal was to try something different.  The place fit the bill.  Quiet and simple.  Combo organic grocery and deli.  I enjoyed my sand which.  The bread was great.  I would go back

data.title: Cubano!!!!
data.text: I had no idea what to expect from this little place. This is by far the best Cubanos I have ever had! It was full of flavor and the ladies were super sweet. Highly recommend if you're in Muncie!

data.title: Excellent local ingredients prepared deliciosly.
data.text: A group of 4 of us ate here yesterday and it was yummy!  We all ate pork belly sandwiches on spelt bread.  3 sandwiches with chipotle sauce and one cubano which was mustard based sauce.  The bread was sliced thin enough to not interfere with the flavors of the sandwich and it was toasted crispy in the panini press.   We drank good imported beer from england and germany while we sat at the window seats.  All the ingredients were local and organic and well prepared.  Everyone working there was very friendly and helpful.  When we walked in we were not expecting a store with a deli counter and almost left to go somewhere else.  But the person behind the counter recommended the pork belly and we are very glad he did.  We had a fun and delicious lunch and won't hesitate to eat here again.

data.title: Local, organic and Yummy
data.text:
My husband and I love the farm stand which is a cafe and grocery store all rolled in one. Awesome soups and sandwiches made with fresh local ingredients and the best homemade bread (which they sell). The owner is great and we have had several conversations over a yummy sandwich. Once you have finished your lunch or dinner you can shop for fresh meats, grains, conflict free
Coffee and other items found in store like whole foods/earth fair or trader joes as well as organic health and beauty or cleaning products. Check out the farm stand for
Lunch and take home some organic meats/eggs/veggies for dinner. Great options for vegan, vegetarians or those with gluten allergies. Great parking adjacent to the store.

data.title: Outstanding Paninis
data.text: I have ate here three days in a row if that tells you anything. Two days I had the cubano pork belly panini. One of the best paninis/sandwiches I have ever had. I also have had the ham and bacon panini it was also outstanding. I find the bread outstanding. I feel great knowing that I'm not eating unneeded or unwanted additives and preservatives. Fresh and organic ingredients. I'll be back to sample other dishes. I also do all my grocery shopping there exclusively.

data.title: DELIGHTFUL
data.text: I loved this place. It is quaint, healthy and wholesome. The food was delicious, they take a simple menu item and make it hearty yet healthy. LOVED IT!

owner_response.author: Dave R, Owner at The Downtown Farm Stand, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks Hilary!  I don't think anyone has ever described our menu better than you!  We're so glad you enjoyed it!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Grocery cum Deli/Cafe with delicious, local, responsible, and organicproducts, fare and food!
data.text:
The Downtown Farm Stand located at 125. E. Main Street Muncie, Indiana (downtown) is a Grocery cum Deli/Cafe with delicious, local, responsible, and organic products, fare and food! The small store has locally (and responsibly sourced) local produce as well as organic, gluten free, and very fresh items and cosmetics. They have a nice supply of local produce (which they source and use in their deli selections for the cafe). They also have the traditional fare and items one might find at any organic store (whole grains, cereals meats, vegetables, breads, candies, tea, coffee, cosmetics and wine/beer). 

The Deli/Cafe has a very nice selection of starters, soups, sandwiches, paninis, drinks and desserts. The Roasted Potatoes (with garlic aioli) is an excellent started. The two soups I have tried were Miso and Raman (both were beyond excellent). The Spinach Melt Sandwich (made on absolutely delicious homemade house grain bread) was once of the best sandwiches I have had in a long time. Also, the Avocado Panini and the Cubano Panini are just as excellent! The sides you will receive are fresh fruits of the day (apple/banana). The brownie was delicious as well. 

This is one of those places that you can clearly not go wrong by ordering most of any dish on the deli menu. Also, take some time to check out the merchandise or organic coffee or beer whilst your order is made fresh. The flavors came out in each dish, with each bite and were so fresh that you could clearly identify them each (on their own) and they complimented each other flawlessly (a sign of excellent cuisine).

data.title: Exceptional!
data.text: Having just returned to Muncie after being away for several years, I was delighted to find a local shop that serves delicious and healthy organic food! My stomach hasn't felt this good in a while!

data.title: Fabulous sandwich
data.text: This place is great- had a handmade really authentic organic sandwich and excellent coffee! Also bought a bunch of good food. Nice people. Really a recommendation!

data.title: Great little store
data.text: My wife and I were visiting Anderson, IN and were in search of a healthier choice for lunch. We came across the Farm Stand and we very please with the decision to drive the 30 min there. It's got a very small town grocery feel with a good selection of organic grocery items. They also have a counter where you can order sandwiches and soup. Everything we had tasted great and the service was very friendly. This would be my go to store if I lived anywhere near it.

data.title: Veg-friendly, fresh, tasty food in downtown Muncie
data.text:
We ate lunch here recently after taking my daughter to tour Ball State University.  
I normally don't care for farm-to-table or locavore type places, simply because I'm vegan and find that these types of places are often meat and dairy-centric, and the vegan options are limited or non-existent.  
But this was NOT the case here.  There were actually more than a few vegetarian options, and all could easily be made vegan just by leaving the cheese off.  

I had the veggie sandwich, with hummus and fresh raw vegetables (it normally comes with feta, too) and it was substantial and delicious.  The bread and hummus tasted homemade, don't know if they were.  The vegetables and greens on the sandwich were tasty and fresh.  
My daughter had a panini (she is okay with dairy) and said hers was delicious as well.

Our sandwiches were so big, in fact, we could only eat half and had to take the rest with us.  
They also offer natural sodas and drinks, and organic wine and beer, which is nice.  

This is actually a grocery with a deli, and tables for eating are in the front of the store.  Although you are eating, basically, in a grocery store, it's still a nice atmosphere, because the store is old and quaint, but clean and well-kept.  

I would definitely eat here again if I go back to Muncie.

data.title: The greenest place in town to eat and shop
data.text: Fabulous local fresh food.  Organic and well researched choices.  Dave and Sara also have a great deli and fresh fair trade coffee.

data.title: Healthy and Organic
data.text: Excellent place to have an organic healthy lunch and buy organic food.  You can also find health and beauty items.

data.title: Tasty with fresh, organic, quality  ingredients
data.text: This is a wonderful little place to eat in downtown Muncie. The sandwiches and soups are delicious and wholesome. The ingredients are healthy and fresh. It is also about $8 for a sandwich, but you get what you pay for. It's less of a restaurant than a few tables in a health food store. It's the only place I know of in the area catering to the granola crowd. If you are concerned about what goes inside your body and want organic or vegan options this is a good place to go. My wife loves it because the food is light and fresh. If you like cheap, heavy food this isn't the place for you. A light lunch for two ran us about $22 and it isn't quite full service.
